Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to encourage generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one-step closer. If you’re driven to discover, build, and encourage something, that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

With an unmatched history building groundbreaking advances in science and technology, JPL has been in the space exploration business since the beginning. We are located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we encourage passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward perfection.

Responsibilities:

Be a member of the Reviews, Reporting & Business Administration Office, within the Project Support Office (PSO). Our office provides the project engineering and management infrastructure and compliance technical assistance required to assure mission success for Laboratory flight projects at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL). The office defines and facilitates satisfaction of the minimum set of technical and programmatic requirements applicable to flight projects primarily in the late formulation and development phases of the project life cycle. As a summer intern for PSO, you will assist with the maintenance of PSO websites, repository management, document management and administrative activities for the Reviews, Reporting & Business Administration Office, including support to the Office Manager. Tasks include but are not limited to:

  • Support website(s) updates;
  • Support website(s) configuration management process;
  • Maintain access and permissions rights on website(s);
  • Interact with various points of contacts and Subject Matter Expert’s (SMEs) on updates for website(s) maintenance;
  • Support the PSO Knowledge Capture repository;
  • Support maintenance of various developed applications for PSO;
  • Assist office Systems Administrator with equipment moves, orders, and tracking;
  • Ensure accuracy of equipment information; and
  • Other information technology related support as assigned.

Required Qualifications:

  • Must be currently enrolled at an accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor's DegreeComputer Science, Information Technology, Library Information Science, or related discipline with a graduation date of December 2023 or later.
  • Must be available to work full-time (40 hrs/wk) for 10 to 12 weeks;
  • Must have completed minimum two years of an accredited computer science or information technology undergraduate course of study;
  • Must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0;
  • Must be able to learn new technologies quickly and work independently;
  • Must have completed basic software courses and have working knowledge of GitHub, Python, Java, Javascript, HTML, Jira and Alfresco

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Website editing experience
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Be a self-starter who can work independently on assignments under general supervision; typically receiving general or detailed instructions on new assignments and
  • A task-oriented team player with strong customer service skills and excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication, and planning skills
  • Ability to interface with all levels of personnel and the ability to resolve multifaceted issues

The typical hourly rate for this job in Pasadena, California depending on education level is $16.11 as a freshman, $19 as a sophomore, $22 as a junior, $25 as a senior.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
